title.narrative: HCFC Phase Out Management Plan (Stage I)

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to develop the first stage of the Compliance Strategy and its corresponding Action Plan for the phase out of the substances controlled under Annex C Group I (HCFCs) of the Montreal Protocol, for the period up to year 2020, that includes the freezing in 2013, the first reduction of 10% from the baseline by 2015, and the second reduction of 35% from the baseline by 2020. The adoption of this strategy was based on previous experiences of the country during the implementation of CFC phase out projects, including the proper refrigerants management, the technical assistance and training of the different stakeholders involved in the phase out, the adequate traffic control for these substances, and the continuous monitoring of the activities implemented under the phase out projects. Thus, six components will comprise the activities to be developed in Stage 1 of the phase out strategy: 1) Component for updating the ODS-related legal framework; (UNEP) 2) Technical Assistance component in the refrigeration and air conditioning services sector; (UNIDO) 3) Technical Assistance component for strengthening the ODS traffic control; (UNEP) 4) Component of Communication Media Awareness; (UNEP) 5) Conversion of the company FOGEL in the foam manufacturing sector; and (UNIDO) 6) Component of the HPMP
